vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application has an XSS vulnerability where user input is not properly sanitized before being rendered in the HTML response

semantic_details.description: Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability due to insufficient input validation and sanitization
impact: Execution of arbitrary JavaScript in user browsers
scenario: Attacker provides malicious input containing JavaScript
Application filters some known dangerous patterns but not all
Malicious input is rendered in the HTML response
JavaScript executes in victim's browser when viewing the page

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application creates temporary HTML files with user-controlled content that could lead to path traversal or local file inclusion

semantic_details.description: Insecure file operations with temporary files containing user input
scenario: Application creates temporary HTML files with user input
Files are stored in a predictable location
Files could be accessed by other users or processes before deletion

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application explicitly disables browser XSS protection by setting X-XSS-Protection header to 0

semantic_details.description: Browser XSS protection is explicitly disabled
impact: Browsers will not apply built-in XSS filtering
Increased risk of successful XSS attacks
scenario: Browser's built-in XSS protection is disabled
XSS attacks that might have been blocked by the browser can succeed
